quizzes.textContent:
[h1]String Operators[/h1]

The most useful operator for strings is [i]concatenation[/i], represented by the + sign. 
Concatenation can be used to build strings by joining together multiple strings, or by joining strings with other types: 
[code format="js" codeId="659"]var mystring1 = "I am learning ";
var mystring2 = "JavaScript with SoloLearn.";
document.write(mystring1 + mystring2);[/code]
The above example declares and initializes two string variables, and then concatenates them. [img id="2750" width="100%"]
[note]Numbers in quotes are treated as strings: "42" is not the number 42, it is a string that includes two characters, 4 and 2.[/note]
